intro: Erysimum arkansanum var. angustifolium, commonly known as narrowleaf wallflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the southeastern United States. It features basal rosettes of linear, grass-like leaves that are typically 2–8 inches long. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers in early spring, which are borne on slender, branching stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable choice for rock gardens or wildflower meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive and ecologically valuable plant for native plant gardens.
